intro: Stillingia tanguinia, commonly known as the Tanguina stelleria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers and lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
